document_content.title: Referral for Further Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue and Joint Pain

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Reynolds is being referred for further evaluation and management of persistent fatigue and diffuse joint pain that have not responded to initial therapy.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports experiencing generalized fatigue and aching in multiple joints, particularly her knees, wrists, and fingers, for the past 4 months. Symptoms are worse in the mornings, with stiffness lasting approximately 45 minutes. She denies fevers, weight loss, or recent infections. Over-the-counter analgesics have provided minimal relief.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: No significant past medical history. No known allergies. No history of autoimmune disease in the family.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: On examination, mild tenderness over bilateral wrists and knees, with no visible swelling or erythema. No rashes observed. Vitals stable.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent laboratory tests reveal mildly elevated ESR (28 mm/hr) and CRP (12 mg/L). ANA and rheumatoid factor are pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistence of symptoms and initial lab findings, I am referring Ms. Reynolds for specialist evaluation to rule out early inflammatory arthritis or other connective tissue disorders. Your assessment and recommendations for further management would be appreciated.
